meanings.definition: To act or speak boldly or shamelessly.
meanings.sent1: She outbrazens her fears and speaks up in class.
meanings.sent2: He outbrazens the consequences and continues to argue.
meanings.sent3: The little boy outbrazens his bedtime by pretending to be a superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her outbrazens attitude in negotiations surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The politician's outbrazens behavior made a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: To face or meet boldly or defiantly.
meanings.sent1: The knight outbrazens the dragon in the epic battle.
meanings.sent2: She outbrazens the challenges ahead with determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbrazens the vacuum cleaner, refusing to move from its spot.
meanings.sent4: His outbrazens stare made his opponent uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The student outbrazens the difficult exam with a confident smile.

meanings.definition: To surpass in boldness or audacity.
meanings.sent1: The daredevil outbrazens all others with his risky stunts.
meanings.sent2: She outbrazens her competitors with her innovative ideas.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outbrazens the birds by stealing their food without them noticing.
meanings.sent4: His outbrazens plan shocked even the experienced detectives.
meanings.sent5: The artist outbrazens the critics with his unconventional masterpiece.
